title: test_distributions.py should seed on setUp, to make it harder to accidentally commit nondeterministic tests
body_html:
Right now it seeds only if you call _set_rng_seed which means it's easy to forget to call it, leading to a nondeterministic test.

Instead, we should modify setUp in common.py and have it seed Numpy as well as Torch:

class TestCase(unittest.TestCase):
    precision = 1e-5
    maxDiff = None

    def setUp(self):
        torch.manual_seed(SEED)

CC @fritzo

body:
Right now it seeds only if you call `_set_rng_seed` which means it's easy to forget to call it, leading to a nondeterministic test.

Instead, we should modify `setUp` in `common.py` and have it seed Numpy as well as Torch:

```
class TestCase(unittest.TestCase):
    precision = 1e-5
    maxDiff = None

    def setUp(self):
        torch.manual_seed(SEED)
```

CC @fritzo
